title: Here are the Boston Public Library’s most-borrowed books of 2025
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Books All of the top ten most-borrowed books in 2025 were written by women.
A view of the grand staircase lions by Louis Saint-Gaudens near the entrance of The Boston Public Library.

(David L Ryan/Globe Staff) By Annie Jonas December 17, 2025 | 2:58 PM 2 minutes to read The Boston Public Library released its most-checked out books in 2025 this week, and like last year, women authors dominated the list.

title: Ravens coach John Harbaugh reveals his biggest worries facing the Patriots
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: New England Patriots "Big plays is the biggest thing when you look at their offense.
" Ravens Bengals Football This Sunday’s contest between the Patriots and Ravens has major implications for both sides, as both teams still have a shot at winning their respective divisions.
The Patriots (11-3) have the AFC East in their control, as they can win out and guarantee their first title since 2019.

title: Chelsea family with legal status files complaint after violent ICE encounter, lawyers say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News Hilda Ramirez Sanan and her two children were detained by ICE officers while accompanying a family member to a court hearing, the ACLU said.

By Sana Muneer December 17, 2025 | 2:42 PM 2 minutes to read An immigration group filed a civil rights complaint against Immigration and Customs Enforcement on Monday on behalf of a Chelsea mother and her children with legal status who had a violent interaction with agents in September, the group said.
“My family is broken and will never be the same,” the mother said.

title: Boston man arrested in 1997 cold case homicide
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The suspect, Brian Keazer, was in his early 20s at the time of the homicide.
A Boston man was arrested in connection with a 1997 cold case on Tuesday.

title: Boston Legacy FC announce signing of goalkeeper Laurel Ivory
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Sports News “The fact that I can be a part of Boston sports history in some way, shape, or form means the world to me and I’m really excited to build something in a sports town that means so much to me.
" Boston Legacy FC goalkeeper Laurel Ivory.
Via Boston Legacy FC By Hayden Bird December 17, 2025 | 11:31 AM 1 minute to read Boston Legacy FC announced the signing of goalkeeper Laurel Ivory on Wednesday.
